One of our units in math is measurement and we really haven’t touched on it yet but today I want to just kind of introduce you to measurement because a lot of the times a teacher will say, “Okay, we’re gonna work on measurement.  First we’re gonna talk about perimeter and then we’re gonna talk about area. And then we’re gonna talk about volume and you really don’t get to see, play around, touch, feel, understand what it is that is being measured, what you need to use to measure something, all of those different things.  And when to use something and when to not use something when you are measuring something. So, first we’re gonna start off, I’m gonna give you your sheet that we’ll walk through today during our assignment.  Then once we’re finished you’ll have an activity on the back to complete on your own.  So, today, we’re just gonna get started. You have to find like the same at some point and when I say this I don’t mean they’re supposed to be perfect. Sometimes measurements are off a little bit.  They’re not exactly on target.  But at the same time it doesn’t mean that it couldn’t be done.  It doesn’t mean that you couldn’t get close.
